ai.summary: An easy 3.8 km out-and-back coastal walk around Burgh Castle Roman Fort near Great Yarmouth. The route is flat and suitable for beginners, families, and casual walkers, featuring the Roman fort ruins, sea views, and open skies along the coastline.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly flat, with well-maintained gravel and grassy paths. Occasional uneven sections near the fort ruins and damp or muddy stretches after rain. Expect coastal winds and sun exposure.
ai.safety_notes: Watch footing on uneven ground near the fort; stay on marked paths and avoid ruins. Be cautious of slippery surfaces after rain. Dress in layers for strong coastal winds, wear sun protection, and carry water and a charged phone. If extending toward the shore, be aware of tides and stay clear of unstable areas near the water.
recommended_gear: Map or offline map/phone with GPS
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (April–September) offer the most comfortable conditions for dry paths and clear sea views; the trail is accessible year-round but weather can be windy and wet outside these months.
